problems.description: Implement a function to check if a bracket sequence is balanced using a stack data structure. Push opening brackets onto the stack and pop when encountering closing brackets, ensuring they match the most recent opening bracket. The sequence is balanced if the stack is empty at the end and all brackets are properly paired. Example: '{[()()]}' should return true, while '([)]' should return false. Only JavaScript is allowed.
problems.inputs description: Input consists of a bracket sequence of '(', ')', '{', '}', '[', and ']'.
problems.expected description: true if the sequence is valid otherwise false

problems.description: Implement a function that reverses only the first K elements of a queue while maintaining the order of remaining elements. Use a stack to temporarily store the first K elements (dequeue K elements and push to stack), then pop from stack back to queue to reverse their order, finally dequeue and re-enqueue the remaining elements to restore their original positions. Example: [10,9,24,100,2,300,258,59] with K=4 should become [100,24,9,10,2,300,258,59]. Only JavaScript is allowed.
problems.inputs description: Input consists of an array of numbers - inp1 and the number K - inp2.
problems.expected description: Array of numbers like the input array with the first k numbers reversed.

problems.description: Implement a stack-based evaluator for Reverse Polish Notation (RPN) expressions. Process tokens left to right: push operands onto the stack, and when encountering an operator, pop two operands, perform the operation (second popped operand first), and push the result back. The final stack should contain exactly one element - the result. Example: ['2', '1', '+', '3', '*'] evaluates as (2+1)*3 = 9. Only JavaScript is allowed.
problems.inputs description: Input consists of an array of strings representing a Reverse Polish Notation (RPN) expression. Each string is either an integer or one of the operators '+', '-', '*', or '/'.
problems.expected description: An integer representing the evaluated result of the RPN expression.
